The Commander of the patrol sloop Le Vaudreuil reported that the Egyptians were occupying the interior between Obock and Tadjoura. In actuality

Only a few Arab dhows (boutres) managed to run the blockade to Djibouti and Obock and only two French ships from Madagascar managed to run it. The Japanese declaration of war (7 December 1941) gave the colony some respite

column23: Obock's circle was created by division of that of Tadjourah region.

column1: A third independence referendum was held in the French Territory of the Afars and the Issas on 8 May 1977. The previous referendums were held in 1958 and 1967
column2: which rejected independence. This referendum backed independence from France. A landslide 98.8% of the electorate supported disengagement from France
column3: officially marking Djibouti's independence. Obock is expected to be the site of the Chinese naval base in Djibouti.

column2: Obock issued its own postage stamps; for more detail see Postage stamps and postal history of Obock.

column1: Obock is connected to other environs by RN-9 National Highway.  A ferry ride from Djibouti City to Obock takes three hours; the distance is 237 km (147 mi).

Obock has a dry climate. It is classified as hot and semi-arid (Köppen climate classification BSh). Obock is 13 m above sea level on the plateau of Gazelles ("Dala-h Húgub in Afar") in desert terrain. The sky is always clear and bright throughout the year.
The submarine coastal spring waters have an interesting geothermal potential (with a deep temperature of approximatively 200°C).
